item.title: Pierce meets OKCPD reps second time
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Kelsey Pierce, Oklahoma City bike rider who was stopped by OKCPD Officer James Herlihy Oct. 19 and given questionable treatment, met for a second time with department representatives Thursday. Pierce has filed a complaint against the officer for what she considered rough treatment when the officer was investigating calls of suspicious bike riders around NW […]

The post Pierce meets OKCPD reps second time appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Bike ride turns to fearful encounter with police
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Fear led to more fear Thursday morning as Kelsey Pierce was riding her bike to work at the Tower Theater on NW 23rd Street. A sudden encounter with Oklahoma City police officer James Herlihy at NW 21st and Dewey led to what Pierce described as “complete fear” when the officer handcuffed her and placed her […]

The post Bike ride turns to fearful encounter with police appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Paco Balderrama first Hispanic major in OKC PD history
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Paco Balderrama was promoted to the rank of major in the Oklahoma City Police Department Tuesday. He is the first officer from Hispanic culture to be promoted to the rank of major in the history of the Oklahoma City Police Department, formed in 1898. Chief Bill Citty presented Balderrama with his new major’s insignia in […]

The post Paco Balderrama first Hispanic major in OKC PD history appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
